website_summaries.verdict: The one to buy if your plans include roughing it in remote campsites or extreme hiking. Easy to assemble and lightweight.
pros: Titanium plates fold flat for easy storage
Accepts many natural sources of fuel
Can be used as a warmer in places where open flames are banned
cons: Inferior clones of the original Emberlit stove have flooded the market
Maintaining a fire can be challenging, especially in windy conditions

customer_reviews.title: Still light weight, but...
customer_reviews.text: Still pretty light weight, but it weighs in at 7 3/8oz without sleeve, with sleeve weighs in at 8oz. Wouldn't be 3 stars if they didn't advertise the weight as 5.45oz.
customer_reviews.author: shane

customer_reviews.title: Description is not correct.
customer_reviews.text: Looks to be well made and could have been a great purchase, but...this is stainless steel, not titanium as stated in the description. the sticker on the outside of the clear plastic bag says titanium but the actual printing on the manufacturer package says "Stainless Steel" in large blue letters. I promptly returned it. They do make a stainless version of this exact stove and it's way cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight collapsible stove--works ok, not great as far as I am concerned
customer_reviews.text: The stove is as advertised, easy to put together. However, I bought it to carry instead of my biolite stove on a long canoe trip. I couldn't keep the Emberlit stove lit; took 30 min to boil water, smokes a lot. So I can understand, if you were going on a short hike for the afternoon; just throw this in your pack with some sort of pot to heat water in, and you would be good to go. On a long trip I need something that will boil water quicker, doesn't smoke so much, and stays lit while I am cooking
customer_reviews.author: W C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Backpackers
customer_reviews.text: I used this on our first night of camping. I was worried that the product was so flimsy it would not hold up to the heat. But, it did. I cooked an entire meal on it and it did not warp or crumble. It was easy to assemble and worked well. Sturdy and stable while in use. Pots sit solidly on it. Focuses heat where you need it. It is more fit for a backpacker that needs to go light. I had other methods of cooking and found that I used them more than I did this product. It lost a star because it was sooty after use and did not clean well.
customer_reviews.author: Big Al

customer_reviews.title: Great power house!
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking to go ultra light, short of bringing nothing with you, then look no further! The form and function of this stove is wonderful. Very light, folds away neatly, and once constructed (easily) it is very rigid and has no problem even holding heavy pots. Also love the efficiency of the stove where a little wood goes a long way, since airflow is plenty, along with easy access to keep feeding the fire. I consider this a premium product (light weight) so price seems well worth it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Weight inaccuracies.
customer_reviews.text: This one weighs 7.3 oz without case, not the advertised 5.4. I advise you to weigh your products if you order. I belive whomever packaged this KNEW this as they attempted to sharpie out the weight on the packaging. I’m disappointed. I dont think this is UL as advertised. I’m considering ordering another to see if I get same product but may skip it. The sharpie felt deceitful.
customer_reviews.author: Nikita

customer_reviews.title: It couldn't be better
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight, gets very hot & cooks easily. I boiled some water & fried a few eggs and bacon for breakfast. Easy to clean up & the titanium cools very quickly. I would give it more stars if I could. Better than relying on a gas bottle, but it also works well with solid Esbit fuel if you want a quick boil.
customer_reviews.author: Scotto D

customer_reviews.title: Perfect purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Very slim and light and once together very sturdy. Made in the USA with lifetime warrenty. Case has instructions on how to put together. Perfect for backpacking or cycling! Got a fire going innit, had a pit that would fit 4 cups of water, 10 minute fire brought it to steam and hot to touch on a snowing day but not enough wood to boil. It cooled off quickly after fire was out.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Dobro

customer_reviews.title: Super Light, Strong, Superior Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Fit's into my fire kit bag like it's not even there! This FANTASTIC! exactly what I was looking for! This is perfect for any "Go Bag" or camping equipment. You can bring the Emberlit Titanium UL anywhere and its strong enough to hold a heavy cast iron pan for cooking! I'm sure this Portable fire stove will last a lifetime if you treat it right and care for it well enough! Definitely a MUST HAVE and worth every penny!.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the ultralight camper
customer_reviews.text: First off, Great service, when I had an issue with the stove. I love this thing, it's small and lightweight enough that I can fit it inside my Molle Waterbottle holder front pocket, while my entire cookset fits inside the main pouch. With some tinder, a lighter, and a firesteel on the side, and my Sawyer mini in the same pockets as the Emberlit, I'm set. I made a pouch out of tyvek, in the shape of an envelope, to keep the pouch clean, and protect from the somewhat sharp edges of the stove. It does the job perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: SE Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great stove due to compatibility and quality
customer_reviews.text: Great stove due to compatibility and quality. I don't think solid fuel tables would be practical given the hight between the bottom of unit and top of stove where you place your cooking pan/cup. I also like that this could be used as a "warming fire" for areas that don't allow open files. You can get reasonable warmth for the effort and it's lifts the spirits to sit around and chat about the 14'er you bagged!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Morales

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lightweight stove.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent stove. Superior camp stove in every way. Very light. Sturdy when assembled. Pretty good quality case that should last and keep soot off. Price varies considerably especially if you wait until off season. I had strongly considered going with ss instead to save money but I'm glad I didn't. At a favorable price, this isn't that much more and well worth it. Leave it in your cart and wait for a price drop. Many videos show it in use. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Beans

customer_reviews.title: works great. filled it up and boiled a potato no ...
customer_reviews.text: turned all sorts of trippy colors after being used, works great. filled it up and boiled a potato no issues. also mine came with a carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: Sky

customer_reviews.title: Great wood burner
customer_reviews.text: I had the steel one and it was stolen from my truck I decided to get this one as it is lighter and will open up my options for cooking when I drop below 3500 feet in the Olympics and can use it as a wind screen when using my gas stove.
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stove!
customer_reviews.text: This is a most excellent stove! Very light weight, very compact when disassembled and very, very easy to assemble! I've only done an initial burn in but I was most impressed with the set up and the efficient manner in which it heated up my water (only one cup but it took less than 5 minutes). I would definitely recommend this stove!
customer_reviews.author: Seeker 1160Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Find a way to get the sharp edges off and you should be good to go
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for the trip, but the edges are VERY sharp! I sliced open my finger reaching into the bag to get it out. Advice? Find a way to get the sharp edges off and you should be good to go. Worked really well, was light weight, and functioned fine in the areas we visited. Always make sure you can have a wood burning fire with the rangers!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for this SCAM!!
customer_reviews.text: If I was the only one this happened to, I could possibly overlook an honest mistake, but there are many reviews with this same problem. I ordered a Titanium Stove, the label on my packaging says it is Titanium, but it is clearly not. Luckily I have an accurate scale to weigh it and sure enough, my stove is 50% heavier than the titanium version. Might be aluminum or some high chromium alloy but it is not Titanium.
customer_reviews.author: Biff BAKA

customer_reviews.title: easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: easy to assemble. More difficult to keep burning. Very small firebox means of it isn't fed it will burn out in minutes. But it will hold up a full size cast iron Dutch oven. Breaks down to 1/8 inch thick by about 4x5. Not allowed anywhere open fires are banned. Maybe something to think about before you depend on it as a cooking source
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of kit here
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of kit here. This stove really puts out a great hot fire. I recommend using this in the backyard before trying in the field. Once you get this down it performs very well and has many uses from cooking to having a small contained fire to keep you warm. One thing I really like about this is that it is classified as a stove so you can use it where some fires are restricted.
customer_reviews.author: RyanSedley

customer_reviews.title: Great wood burner
customer_reviews.text: This stove is perfect and stupidly simple to assemble and east to use. Lighting this stove is easy and the side feed port works, a few thumb sized sticks 18 inches long provides plenty of burn time. I have the solo type can stoves and think this is much better design and easer to cook on. This stove is very light and packs well compared to the can type of stoves.
customer_reviews.author: Glen E ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing. I used a fistful of twigs and some ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I used a fistful of twigs and some juniper bark and had a roaring little blaze going in 30 seconds. After I put out the fire, the titanium stove cooled to ambient temperature very quickly, allowing me to easily disassemble it and be on my way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This stove is really light, functions well, and is quite versatile.
customer_reviews.text: This stove is really light, functions well, and is quite versatile. It works well with grass and twigs as the fuel source. For alternative fuels, it also works well both with an alcohol stove inserted and Esbit fuel, and should be an effective wind screen for both although the Esbit burns down in about a third less time that it would in an Esbit stove. It also cools down quickly for packing.
customer_reviews.author: homeboy

customer_reviews.title: Irks well and is ultra light.
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, works well, sets up easily only problem is case is cheaply made. Will get a small tuber ware style box to place which will hold fire kit and tenter.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Burnette

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Stove!
customer_reviews.text: I am in the outdoors all the time hunting, camping, backpacking, and on survival trips, so I have seen my fair share of stoves over the last 20 years. This is by far the best stove I have ever owned and seen. It packs down small and fits in the bottom of my camelback. I am glad I spent the extra money for the titanium model for the light weight, because I can see this stove lasting many years. It is a great product and I have two friends that have now bought them one as well.
customer_reviews.author: ICtracks

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and great..
customer_reviews.text: Works great, made a video of it on my YouTube channel Hoobilly Indiana...
customer_reviews.author: hoobilly65

customer_reviews.title: It works perfectly as long as there is absolutely no ...
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly as long as there is absolutely no breeze. I couldn't keep a fire in this, no matter how big I had it going, to last through any wind when cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: It works great! Super light weight. Goes together easy. It would also make a great windscreen if you are using a pepsican stove or esbit fuel. I hope to save on fuel weight using this on the PCT.
customer_reviews.author: michael mcilroy

customer_reviews.title: It's sooty, but it's a good stove.
customer_reviews.text: Breaks down great, light, no need to carry fuel unless it's raining. It does create a lot of soot and smoke. You will be filthy. However, the benefits of using twigs instead of bought fuel wins the day.
customer_reviews.author: Thunderferret

customer_reviews.title: TITANIUM ROCKS!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it. I've had the stainless steel version for years. I'm a titanium junky but my SS emberlit never let me down so I never got this one. Recently I changed my mind when I wanted to try and reduce my kits weight. This is half the weight. Strong yet light as a feather.
customer_reviews.author: Customer 1

customer_reviews.title: I like it!  Great little design
customer_reviews.text: Really, I haven"t had it outside yet, but I put a pot of water on it, with a Triangia burner inside, and it put out a terrific amount of heat, centered right on the pot. Had four cups of water steaming hot by the time one ounce of alcohol burned out. Easy to set up and to disassemble, it'll be a great campstove. Looking forward to trying it out with a wood fire.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Emberlite Titanium Stove
customer_reviews.text: It's an exceptionaly well made and designed back country,day hiking and 'survival' stove...very light and efficent! A great investment...it may seem 'pricy' but it's worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: wwg

customer_reviews.title: light and strong!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it camping yet, but it's light and fits together well. I did put a heavy pot on it to test stability and strength, holds up well! Very stable! Stores very flat and comes with sleeve case for storage. I'm looking forward to using.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: A great stove. The stove is light
customer_reviews.text: A great stove. The stove is light, takes up little room and does not require you to carry additional fuel. You can use available fuel. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: mikec

customer_reviews.title: Great stove
customer_reviews.text: this is a great wood burning stove light and works like a charm I can't even explain how happy I am that I purchased this if you're on the fence just get it the price might be a little intimidating but it's worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: Alan J

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: After a 3 day backpacking trip, while there is a learning curve to keep the stove fueled, it made short work of my meals taking a fraction of the fuel that other stoves I have used have needed. Whats more, it is so light, folds almost flat, and can pack it anywhere, even in my back pocket. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It just works
customer_reviews.text: I love this stove. Tough material, packs flat, assembles in seconds, very strong design. It "just works". If anyone is wondering, this stove can support a pot much larger than it could heat.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Item was as stated in the ad.Item arrived on time and without any damage.
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: Must have ember light  titanium
customer_reviews.text: Small and lightweight yet extremely sturdy. My husband absolutely loves it for cooking outdoors. It hold heavy outdoor cookware. A great gift for those who love cooking outdoors:)
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Typpo

customer_reviews.title: Four sides, a bottom, and top cross bars ...
customer_reviews.text: Four sides, a bottom, and top cross bars... rock solid once assembled. Disassembled it lies flat in about a 1/8" thick pile. Extremely light weight. This is expensive, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is advertised to do. Light and ...
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is advertised to do. Light and compact, anyplace with twigs will have fuel for this without carrying it.
customer_reviews.author: Duane J. Mader

customer_reviews.title: Great for the minimalist backpacker in your life
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband's birthday and he loves it! Great for the minimalist backpacker in your life. Super efficient stove that you don't have to carry the fuel with you. He's taking it hunting this week and is super excited.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh M.

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome stove. Easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome stove. Easy assembly, super lightweight, sturdy and I can boil water in about 10 minutes from the start of the fire. Love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: WoodsWalker

customer_reviews.title: Not as light as expected, but overall - the best stove I've tried!
customer_reviews.text: Not as light as expected, but overall - the best stove I've tried!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hicks

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Stove
customer_reviews.text: Super light weight and takes up no space. You get a very focused flame from this, it had my water boiling in under 3 minutes (I didn't use a watch).
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: This stove is perfect for your bug out bag (BOB)
customer_reviews.text: This stove is perfect for your bug out bag (BOB). super lightweight and the best brand out there in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Digirati

customer_reviews.title: Cooks great.
customer_reviews.text: as advertised. Also used it to have a tiny fire when I was in the BC. Cooks great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice little lantern. Burns very efficiently. Light. Keeps you busy feeding it.
customer_reviews.author: johannes liebert

customer_reviews.title: I like the carrying sleeve it comes with
customer_reviews.text: Very light, durable and portable. I like the carrying sleeve it comes with. It keeps my backpack clean and the ash off all my stuff. I would buy this again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: B. Vaccaro

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Ultra light weight, durable, easy to set up, a lot of people wil bash you for bringing a stove in the backwoods when you can just "build a fire anywhere" I love the option of having a small, easy, contained fire when I need one.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Light & Strong!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is THEE BEST personal cook stove out there! It's the perfect size for camping pans & it's so light to carry! I would recommend this above any camp stove going!!!
customer_reviews.author: Didi

customer_reviews.title: Great stove!
customer_reviews.text: Light, rigid and well built. Exactly as described. Performed very well on recent trip at 5k-8k elevation. Great stove!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Gifford

customer_reviews.title: Super light!
customer_reviews.text: Super light!! Easy to use after a few attempts. When using it, I found that the more tinder you have/use, the easier it is to keep the fire going. Overall I am pleased with it, and plan on buying again!
customer_reviews.author: brandt

customer_reviews.title: Only problem I've had is with the sleeve. Upon ...
customer_reviews.text: Only problem I've had is with the sleeve. Upon arrival one side hadn't been sewn. Product in a ziploc bag until i can sew the sleeve. Update: Contacted the seller and they are sending me a replacement sleeve.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Newton

customer_reviews.title: This stove works great!
customer_reviews.text: What a great stove. Very, very light weight!!!! Works great, and it very sturdy!! Ember It did a great job of designing this stove.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoorsman

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly light and sturdy. Ideal for the solo hiker. I would buy again but I won't need to! I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandre Filion

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it already
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat this stove. Very light, no need to carry fuel, and I get two cups of water to boil in less than ten minutes. The SS version is heavier, but still lighter than a can of fuel for my pocket rocket. A little pricey at eighty dollars, but one of my favorite pieces of kit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It can be tricky to light but it's easy to figure out
customer_reviews.text: Functions as promised! Even lighter than I expected, robust and stable enough for larger cook pots. Wood fuel burns to ash completely so there's not much to clean up. It can be tricky to light but it's easy to figure out, and a fistful of damp grass is all you need to scrub it back to new. I was torn between stainless and titanium (and I'm not an ounce counter), but glad I went with Ti in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Woodstomper

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ultra light and takes up zero space. Just what i needed
customer_reviews.author: Adam S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift!!
customer_reviews.text: Was a Christmas gift and the receiver was so excited and happy!! He uses it every time he goes back packing, no complaints!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: I really like the option of fuel and used soild fuel to ...
customer_reviews.text: The titanium caught my attention, as I'm always looking for lighter, more compact. I really like the option of fuel and used soild fuel to light wood fires. Although the metal discolored from heat, the stove held it's shape well and packed up great.
customer_reviews.author: lucky larson

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: A bit pricey, but very lightweight, easy to use, and quite effective. Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: i love it
customer_reviews.text: works awesomen and i used for camping in the beach and is really light doesnt need much space is easy to carry on
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Torres

customer_reviews.title: Superlight packable biofuel stove
customer_reviews.text: Light, compact, easy to setup, easy to use, easy to clean. Produces a nice column of flame that boils water quickly. Am really happy I chose this product. A great addition to my bug out/bushcraft bag. The storage pouch is a really nice addition and is super visible inside the pack.
customer_reviews.author: beldarski

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome stove.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome stove. It performs even better than I could have imagined. Works perfectly even with strong winds. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy H.

customer_reviews.title: They shipped the 11. 3 oz. stainless steel ...
customer_reviews.text: They shipped the 11.3 oz. stainless steel Emberlit with the label of the titanium stove on the box. I now have to send it back in hopes that the next order will be the Emberlit titanium wood burning stove. sheesh
customer_reviews.author: Handy Artist

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS COMPACT STOVE
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS COMPACT STOVE! EASY TO PUT TOGETHER AFTER THE SECOND TIME. I ECHED NUMBERS ON EACH OF THE 3 SIDES STARTING ON THE LEFT SIDE THEN THE BACK THEN THE RIGHT SIDE. THE FORTH ONE IS THE FRONT WHICH IS THE ONLY ONE THAT HAS A OPENING FOR THE MATERIAL YOU ARE USING AS YOUR FUEL THIS STOVE IS VERY STURDY AND CAN HOLD A FAIR SIZE POT. I FIND THE 1.6L POT IS A GOOD SIZE FOR 2. TITANIUM IS THE ONLY WAY TO GO. LIGHTER THAN SS BUT JUST AS STRONG. DOES NOT RUST.
customer_reviews.author: chip

customer_reviews.title: Too sooty for me
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of being able to burn twigs and not carry fuel for UL backpacking. However I am not willing to put up with the messy soot- it is awful and is very difficult to wash off. By the end of the evening soot was everywhere; clothes, towel, sleeping bag, gloves, hands, face. Too much. I'm going back to my whisper light stove unless someone can produce a solution to the soot problem. I can deal with dirt, sap and all that, but not this soot.
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: Met my expectations
customer_reviews.text: This great little stove is perfect for my bug out bag. It is extremely compact. I recommend this for anyone building a bug out bag or a simple camping load out. I advise on getting the titanium to prevent war page and it's also much more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Best burning of wood out of the ones I tried!
customer_reviews.text: Great air flow burns easily and clean and hot. also like the folding of the other large competitors stove but air flow is eh and the top is narrower so this one holds a pot better also.
customer_reviews.author: Scooby Snacks

customer_reviews.title: nice stove but seems a little heavy for titanium
customer_reviews.text: nice stove but seems a little heavy for titanium? good compact backpacking stove. sterno works well in it. very pricey. got here quickly and undamaged.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: The Emberlit titanium stove is perfect. The only thing I would change is maybe dulling the edges a little. It was a bit sharp when I got it but nothing a little sandpaper couldn't fix.
customer_reviews.author: James g.

customer_reviews.title: LITE WEIGHT ,WELL MADE
customer_reviews.text: SEEMS WELL MADE , NOT USED YET . WILL TRY A FOLLOW UP REVEIW IF CAN REGARDS gh
customer_reviews.author: gh

customer_reviews.title: Ordered titanium, got stainless
customer_reviews.text: I ordered titanium, I was charged for titanium, I was delivered stainless steel. Wanted titanium for a trip next week. Now I have to return it and wait for the right one to get here and once AGAIN the money I pay for Prime 2 day delivery is useless. Thanks. Oh and in case you're wondering, the stainless steel version is HEAVY for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Oderd titanium got stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: Order titanium got stainless steel what else is there to say very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: +25% heavier than claimed
customer_reviews.text: The only reason to buy the titanium version over the stainless version is because of being concerned about pack weight. Unfortunately the weight of the titanium stove is not accurate. I returned it immediately. I would not recommend this company until they update their products specifications accurately.
customer_reviews.author: HS

customer_reviews.title: Clone!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this product and it seemed off looking at it and holding it in my hand. I went to Bass Pro Shop on Saturday and the product that i got is not the same shown/ promised by the pictures or the description. It not the name brand its a Chinese clone. BUYER BE WARE! This item is has dazzled edges has air vents on the bottom and its bigger and heavier than the genuine product. -----UPDATE -------- I sent a email to them i get a response a week later and it's been close to a month with out getting anything resolved 3rd email sent today 11/21/15
customer_reviews.author: Larry Linquata

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this from Amazon because it was on sale for $10 less than Emberlit's website directly. It shipped fast and was exactly what I was wanting/expecting. I decided to paint it with 1200 deg black high temp paint just to give it a uniform matte black clean look. We shall see if that actually holds up or was worth my while. This stove is lite weight, extremely compact and just as sturdy as advertized. I'm really happy with the purchase and look forward to using it instead of my Jetboil on the next adventure.
customer_reviews.author: ALW

customer_reviews.title: Get a better pouch!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool unit, nice and light, but a little expensive for what you get, wouldn't have minded getting a little nicer storage pouch for the money I dropped on this thing. The thing is it is light - other than that you are looking at the same concept as a coal starter for you BBQ. Maybe through in a place for matches or something on the new pouch you haven't designed yet.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

product_meta.title: Emberlit Titanium UL Compact Design Perfect for Survival, Camping, Hunting & Emergency Preparation
product_meta.description: The EmberLit-UL (Ultralite) Stove. Weighing in at less than 5.45 oz., the Emberlit-UL stove caters to those who pay special attention to the weight of their gear. Made of pure titanium, the Emberlit-UL is just as strong and impervious to corrosion as it's stainless steel brother, but at half the weight. With use the individual panels that make up the EmberLit-UL may take on a slight warp. This is normal and doesn't affect the assembly or durability of the stove. Likewise it comes with a lifetime guarantee. you'll never wear this one out either. Despite the extra difficulty and expense of working with titanium this stove is PROUDLY Made in the USA.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
